<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you know someone who would enjoy the Brew, you can always forward them the newsletter and ask them (politely) to sign up. <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/29/tenants-withhold-rent-covid19-closures-wreak-havoc?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
How We Gonna Pay Last Month's Rent?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Cheesecake Factory" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zODYvY2hlZXNlY2FrZV9mYWN0b3J5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:Anthony92931" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Anthony92931</a>, <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Cheesecake_Factory_Restaurant.jpg" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Cheesecake Factory Restaurant</a>, <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/legalcode" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-SA 3.0</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We always knew that when the revolution came, it would start with pineapple upside-down cheesecake. On March 18, The Cheesecake Factory told landlords it <a href="https://la.eater.com/2020/3/25/21194144/cheesecake-factory-rent-strike-chain-restaurant?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">couldn't pay April rent</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Mattress Firm has done the same. So has Subway, which declared the spread of coronavirus a “force majeure,” legalese for “this was so unpredictable we can't fulfill the obligations of the contract.” Adidas used the German government’s COVID-19 response as <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/8bfe8e86-39b2-48c1-9a7c-5a527e60d120?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grounds to withhold rent</a>, too.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With physical retail’s revenue streams all but Hoover Dammed right now, these high-stakes gambles illustrate the industry’s level of despair:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>OpenTable said U.S. restaurant bookings are down 100% annually right now. </span></li> 
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>JPMorgan found in 2016 that the median independent restaurant has enough cash to last 16 days and independent retailers 19. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But abstaining from paying rent has downstream consequences. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Tenant troubles today are </span><span><a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2020/03/27/taubman-center-retail-rent-coronavirus-covid-19-pandemic/2926012001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">landlord troubles</a></span><span> tomorrow. Many property owners carry chunky debt loads—and they might rather cash a smaller rent check now than lose their tenants on the precipice of a recession.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Major U.S. mall owner Taubman Centers told its tenants they must pay April rent even though all its malls are closed.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Of course, the rent issue isn’t just between retailers and landlords</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">UChicago found one-third of adults <a href="https://slate.com/business/2020/03/coronavirus-rent-landlords-strike-unemployment.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">can’t cover necessities</a> after missing a single paycheck. One in four tenant families pay over half their income in rent. And for the big finish: Residents owe about $40 billion in April rents, reports Slate.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So what happens now?</strong> The first of the month is two days out. Expect chaos...followed by a tsunami of litigation once this storm passes.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID-19
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/29/coronavirus-catchup-march-30?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Coronavirus Catch Up
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="The Earth superimposed on the coronavirus " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80OS9jb3JvbmF2aXJ1c19lYXJ0aC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With over 135,000 Americans confirmed to have COVID-19, the U.S. now has the most cases in the world by a considerable margin. Here’s the latest:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Travel advisory: </strong>On Saturday, President Trump floated the idea of a short-term quarantine for the tri-state area around New York City but later <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/03/29/trump-new-york-quarantine-mnuchin-coronavirus-153681?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">backed off</a>. He extended social distancing guidelines to April 30.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Sign of the times: </strong>The 2020 Detroit auto show has been canceled while the venue that was supposed to host it gets transformed into a FEMA field hospital, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/28/2020-detroit-auto-show-canceled-due-to-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CNBC reports</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Mass exodus in India: </strong>Hundreds of thousands of migrant workers <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/29/world/asia/coronavirus-india-migrants.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">left India’s cities</a> for their home villages. The government’s 21-day quarantine order instantly eliminated their sources of income.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good news for testing: </strong>On Friday, the FDA <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/health/2020/03/28/coronavirus-fda-authorizes-abbott-labs-fast-portable-covid-test/2932766001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">approved</a> a coronavirus test made by Abbott Labs. It takes as little as five minutes to deliver positive results and could be coming to urgent care centers this week.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><strong style="color:#000">A path forward: </strong>The American Enterprise Institute released a "<a href="https://www.aei.org/research-products/report/national-coronavirus-response-a-road-map-to-reopening/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">road map</a>" to reopening the economy and gradually moving away from heavy physical distancing measures. Right now, the authors argue we need to get much smarter about testing. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INEQUALITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/29/coronavirus-quarantines-expose-economic-inequality?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Not All Quarantines Are Created Equal
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="David Geffen's yacht" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zOTEvZGF2aWRfZ2VmZmVuX3NfeWFjaHQuanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>davidgeffen on Instagram</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With a single Saturday morning Instagram post, billionaire producer David Geffen reminded us that COVID-19 hits differently across class lines.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pandemics are sometimes considered an equalizer—after all, everyone from Tom Hanks to your neighbor can get infected. But today, the spread of the coronavirus and the shutdown of the economy have exposed a “pandemic caste system,” <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/27/business/economy/coronavirus-inequality.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes the NYT</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“The rich holed up in vacation properties; the middle class marooned at home with restless children; the working class on the front lines of the economy.”</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The front lines</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, employees of Instacart are planning <a href="https://medium.com/@GigWorkersCollective/instacart-emergency-walk-off-ebdf11b6995a?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a strike</a> over what they say is a failure by the grocery delivery company to protect workers from coronavirus health risks. They’re also demanding higher pay.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>As Americans ditch physical grocery store shopping for delivery, Instacart has emerged as an essential service during this crisis.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Instacart hires gig economy workers known as “shoppers.” The company currently has about 200,000 shoppers and plans to hire 300,000 more in the next three months.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line, via the Brookings Institution: </strong>“Working from home <a href="https://www.brookings.edu/blog/up-front/2020/03/27/class-and-covid-how-the-less-affluent-face-double-risks/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is a privilege</a>.”</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F03%2F29%2Fcoronavirus-quarantines-expose-economic-inequality" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

</a>
</td>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COMMUNICATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/29/covid19-puts-phone-calls-back-style?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
She Was Onto Something
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Adele" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zODgvYWRlbGUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Adele / YouTube</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before the coronavirus pandemic, phone calls were considered a cultural relic of yesteryear. In other words, we were all <a href="https://www.buzzfeed.com/austingebbia1/20-times-ozzy-osbourne-knew-exactly-what-to-fucking-say?utm_source=dynamic&utm_campaign=bfsharecopy&sub=0_11103592#11103592&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">that Ozzy Osbourne</a><a href="https://www.buzzfeed.com/austingebbia1/20-times-ozzy-osbourne-knew-exactly-what-to-fucking-say?utm_source=dynamic&utm_campaign=bfsharecopy&sub=0_11103592#11103592&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"></a><a href="https://www.buzzfeed.com/austingebbia1/20-times-ozzy-osbourne-knew-exactly-what-to-fucking-say?utm_source=dynamic&utm_campaign=bfsharecopy&sub=0_11103592#11103592&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"> meme</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But now, as we lock ourselves in our homes, <a href="https://www.newyorker.com/culture/culture-desk/in-praise-of-phone-calls?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">phone calls</a> are rivaling jigsaw puzzles in terms of unexpected beneficiaries. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The data to back it up:</strong> Verizon said it’s seen an average of 800 million wireless calls daily on recent weekdays, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/call-me-anytimeno-really-were-all-answering-the-phone-again-11585261816?mod=e2tw&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">almost 2x the call volume</a> on Mother’s Day, per the WSJ. And AT&T said wireless voice minutes last Monday increased 39% from the average Monday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Parting thought...</strong>one of the pleasant surprises of this situation has been reconnecting with old friends. You might want to scroll through your contact list and call that person who would be your best friend if you were living in the same city. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/29/morning-brews-daily-quarantine-planner-march-30?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Your Daily Quarantine Planner: March 30
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Bart Simpson gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=475 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/390/bart_simpson.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Bart Simpson gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/390/bart_simpson.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's Neal Freyman, the Brew's managing editor. I read a <a href="https://twitter.com/realtimrozon/status/1244293963487592448?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">message</a> on Twitter yesterday that helped shaped my thinking of the current situation: "You're not stuck at home. You're safe at home." With that in mind, here's the great day I planned for you...</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/athletic-shoe_1f45f.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Morning workout</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Do you want to do this <a href="https://darebee.com/challenges/abs-of-steel-challenge.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">30-day ab program</a> together? Either way, the entire website is gold. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/headphone_1f3a7.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Work soundtrack </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How can I recommend anything but <a href="https://open.spotify.com/artist/6PAt558ZEZl0DmdXlnjMgD?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Eric Clapton</a> on the legend’s 75th birthday? "<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jUVUJ_Wbw4E&fbclid=IwAR3eIab7nsh-U_ONerCoUl9k5g-__II8rR6724tcRjN2L91J_hBRn7g68jo&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Keep on Growing</a>" is a groove. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/sandwich_1f96a.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Lunch, but make it productive</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Level up: </strong>Read this <a href="https://www.notion.so/Digital-Working-COVID-19-c39e55d0f6024e7f85560ea7b2632997?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">comprehensive guide</a> to digital working. There are useful tips throughout. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Do good: </strong><a href="https://foodtank.com/news/2020/03/support-these-31-organizations-helping-restaurants-workers-and-farmers-survive-covid-19/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Here’s a list</a> of dozens of organizations helping folks in the restaurant and farming industries hurt by the economic crisis.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stay up to date: </strong><a href="https://citymapper.com/nyc?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Citymapper</a> is an excellent resource to keep you informed about public transportation. Play around with their Mobility Index.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/canned-food_1f96b.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">Dinner plans </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Searches for “How to make bread” on Google have skyrocketed. Maybe you should try to be like everyone else and <a href="https://www.google.com/search?rlz=1C5CHFA_enUS871US871&ei=9c6AXpCZOI2RggeEirWoDQ&q=how+to+make+a+sourdough+starter&oq=how+to+make+a+sour&gs_lcp=CgZwc3ktYWIQARgAMgIIADIFCAAQgwEyAggAMgIIADICCAAyAggAMgIIADICCAAyAggAMgIIADoECAAQRzoFCAAQkQJQ7jNYxDhgyUpoAHADeACAAXCIAa0EkgEDNC4ymAEAoAEBqgEHZ3dzLXdpeg&sclient=psy-ab&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">make sourdough</a>. Or you could try <a href="https://twitter.com/lizchar/status/1243573800165408780?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this dish</a>, though honestly I don’t think you should.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/television_1f4fa.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Evening activity</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">No screen: </strong>I’ve been playing a lot of <a href="https://www.catan.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Settlers of Catan</a> recently (recently = while in quarantine). <a href="http://riograndegames.com/Game/36-Bohnanza?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bohnanza</a> is also a really fun board game about bean farming. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Screen: </strong>If you haven’t dipped your toes into Bollywood yet, I highly, highly recommend the movie <em><a href="https://www.netflix.com/title/70121522?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">3 Idiots</a></em>. It's way better than <em>Tiger King</em>. </p>
<hr>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/house-with-garden_1f3e1.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">We want you to live your best quarantined life</strong>—so much so, that we launched a brand new, free newsletter to be your guide. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/the-essentials/?utm_medium=onsite&utm_campaign=dailyplanner_032020&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out The Essentials→</a></em></p>

Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said he expects the small business loan program will be live this week, while many Americans can expect their direct payments in about three weeks.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eU.S. markets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHave stocks hit the bottom? Investors are \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-bull-bear/worry-problems-and-strife-investors-fear-markets-not-out-of-woods-despite-big-rally-idUSKBN21G05E?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejust as unclear\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e as we are, though the Dow is coming off its best week since the 1930s. Data released this week will reveal more damage from this economic crisis.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nREAL ESTATE \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/29/tenants-withhold-rent-covid19-closures-wreak-havoc?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nHow We Gonna Pay Last Month's Rent?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Cheesecake Factory\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zODYvY2hlZXNlY2FrZV9mYWN0b3J5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:Anthony92931\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAnthony92931\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Cheesecake_Factory_Restaurant.jpg\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCheesecake Factory Restaurant\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/legalcode\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCC BY-SA 3.0\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe always knew that when the revolution came, it would start with pineapple upside-down cheesecake. On March 18, The Cheesecake Factory told landlords it \u003ca href=\"https://la.eater.com/2020/3/25/21194144/cheesecake-factory-rent-strike-chain-restaurant?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecouldn't pay April rent\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMattress Firm has done the same. So has Subway, which declared the spread of coronavirus a “force majeure,” legalese for “this was so unpredictable we can't fulfill the obligations of the contract.” Adidas used the German government’s COVID-19 response as \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/8bfe8e86-39b2-48c1-9a7c-5a527e60d120?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egrounds to withhold rent\u003c/a\u003e, too.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith physical retail’s revenue streams all but Hoover Dammed right now, these high-stakes gambles illustrate the industry’s level of despair:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOpenTable said U.S. restaurant bookings are down 100% annually right now. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eJPMorgan found in 2016 that the median independent restaurant has enough cash to last 16 days and independent retailers 19. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut abstaining from paying rent has downstream consequences. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTenant troubles today are \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2020/03/27/taubman-center-retail-rent-coronavirus-covid-19-pandemic/2926012001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elandlord troubles\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e tomorrow. Many property owners carry chunky debt loads—and they might rather cash a smaller rent check now than lose their tenants on the precipice of a recession.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMajor U.S. mall owner Taubman Centers told its tenants they must pay April rent even though all its malls are closed.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOf course, the rent issue isn’t just between retailers and landlords\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUChicago found one-third of adults \u003ca href=\"https://slate.com/business/2020/03/coronavirus-rent-landlords-strike-unemployment.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecan’t cover necessities\u003c/a\u003e after missing a single paycheck. One in four tenant families pay over half their income in rent. And for the big finish: Residents owe about $40 billion in April rents, reports Slate.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo what happens now?\u003c/strong\u003e The first of the month is two days out. Expect chaos...followed by a tsunami of litigation once this storm passes.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith over 135,000 Americans confirmed to have COVID-19, the U.S. now has the most cases in the world by a considerable margin. Here’s the latest:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTravel advisory: \u003c/strong\u003eOn Saturday, President Trump floated the idea of a short-term quarantine for the tri-state area around New York City but later \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/03/29/trump-new-york-quarantine-mnuchin-coronavirus-153681?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebacked off\u003c/a\u003e. He extended social distancing guidelines to April 30.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSign of the times: \u003c/strong\u003eThe 2020 Detroit auto show has been canceled while the venue that was supposed to host it gets transformed into a FEMA field hospital, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/28/2020-detroit-auto-show-canceled-due-to-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCNBC reports\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMass exodus in India: \u003c/strong\u003eHundreds of thousands of migrant workers \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/29/world/asia/coronavirus-india-migrants.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eleft India’s cities\u003c/a\u003e for their home villages. The government’s 21-day quarantine order instantly eliminated their sources of income.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGood news for testing: \u003c/strong\u003eOn Friday, the FDA \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/health/2020/03/28/coronavirus-fda-authorizes-abbott-labs-fast-portable-covid-test/2932766001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapproved\u003c/a\u003e a coronavirus test made by Abbott Labs. It takes as little as five minutes to deliver positive results and could be coming to urgent care centers this week.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eA path forward: \u003c/strong\u003eThe American Enterprise Institute released a \"\u003ca href=\"https://www.aei.org/research-products/report/national-coronavirus-response-a-road-map-to-reopening/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eroad map\u003c/a\u003e\" to reopening the economy and gradually moving away from heavy physical distancing measures. Right now, the authors argue we need to get much smarter about testing. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003edavidgeffen on Instagram\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith a single Saturday morning Instagram post, billionaire producer David Geffen reminded us that COVID-19 hits differently across class lines.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePandemics are sometimes considered an equalizer—after all, everyone from Tom Hanks to your neighbor can get infected. But today, the spread of the coronavirus and the shutdown of the economy have exposed a “pandemic caste system,” \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/27/business/economy/coronavirus-inequality.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites the NYT\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“The rich holed up in vacation properties; the middle class marooned at home with restless children; the working class on the front lines of the economy.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe front lines\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday, employees of Instacart are planning \u003ca href=\"https://medium.com/@GigWorkersCollective/instacart-emergency-walk-off-ebdf11b6995a?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea strike\u003c/a\u003e over what they say is a failure by the grocery delivery company to protect workers from coronavirus health risks. They’re also demanding higher pay.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs Americans ditch physical grocery store shopping for delivery, Instacart has emerged as an essential service during this crisis.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eInstacart hires gig economy workers known as “shoppers.” The company currently has about 200,000 shoppers and plans to hire 300,000 more in the next three months.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line, via the Brookings Institution: \u003c/strong\u003e“Working from home \u003ca href=\"https://www.brookings.edu/blog/up-front/2020/03/27/class-and-covid-how-the-less-affluent-face-double-risks/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis a privilege\u003c/a\u003e.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\"
